sections.text: Brown’s MPH program prepares students to become leaders in improving population health through research, policy, and practice.

items: Core courses in epidemiology and biostatistics
sections.text: Students engage in a rigorous curriculum combining quantitative and qualitative public health training, practical experiences, and a culminating capstone.

items: At least 2 years professional work experience for online MPH
Three recommendation letters (at least one academic if recent graduate)
TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants
sections.text: Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree, provide academic/professional recommendations, transcripts, and demonstrate readiness for advanced study in public health.
Graduates pursue roles in government, healthcare, academia, NGOs, and consulting, addressing pressing public health issues globally.
